body_html:
@khaotik thanks for sharing your unitary code. I have a similar script for unitary. I think as the implementation stands right now, the gradient you're processing from your Unitary Cell is not correct as @ibab illustrated with his newly raised issue. Hopefully this will be resolved in a later build.

Completely on the side (and we can start a separate thread for this) but I do have some questions about your unitary implementation.

  1. Why do you multiply 3 separate times by fft_scale -- in the original paper this is not called for.
  2. Your diag variables do not appear to be diagonal, but rather normal complex matrices.
  3. In your modrelu function you multiply by in_c. From my impression, the paper simply uses as modrelu as an activation function and do not multiply the output by in_c.

body:
@khaotik thanks for sharing your unitary code. I have a similar script for unitary. I think as the implementation stands right now, the gradient you're processing from your Unitary Cell is not correct as @ibab illustrated with his newly raised issue. Hopefully this will be resolved in a later build.

---

Completely on the side (and we can start a separate thread for this) but I do have some questions about your unitary implementation. 
1. Why do you multiply 3 separate times by `fft_scale` -- in the original paper this is not called for.
2. Your `diag` variables do not appear to be diagonal, but rather normal complex matrices. 
3. In your `modrelu` function you multiply by `in_c`. From my impression, the paper simply uses as `modrelu` as an activation function and do not multiply the output by `in_c`.
